resource_dependency.userDataSchema: Database table: users(user_id UUID, username STRING, email STRING, created_at TIMESTAMP).
resource_dependency.chartLibrary: Chart.js or similar library for rendering graphs

function: Display user-specific fitness metrics including total workouts, calories burned, active minutes, and weekly trends.
static_description: A white background page with navy-colored charts and summary cards showing key fitness stats. Charts include line graph for weekly activity and bar chart for daily calorie burn. Summary cards show totals at the top.

interaction_and_states.description: On page load, fetches user stats via fitnessStatsAPI and populates charts and summary cards dynamically.
Triggers re-fetch of data from fitnessStatsAPI to update displayed statistics in real time.

resource_dependency.formValidationRules: Required fields: exercise type, duration (min), date. Optional: notes, intensity level.
resource_dependency.exercisesTableSchema: Database table: exercises(exercise_id UUID, user_id UUID, type STRING, duration INTEGER, date DATE, notes TEXT, intensity ENUM(low, medium, high))

function: Allow users to log new fitness activities through an input form with validation.
static_description: White background page with a navy-themed form containing dropdowns, text inputs, and submit button. Fields include exercise type, duration, date, optional notes, and intensity slider.

interaction_and_states.description: Validates form inputs; if valid, sends POST request to exerciseLogAPI and clears form upon success.
Displays inline error messages next to invalid fields without sending API request.

resource_dependency.diaryDataSchema: Database table: diary_entries(entry_id UUID, user_id UUID, title STRING, content TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP)
resource_dependency.richTextEditor: Embedded rich-text editor component for formatting entries

function: Enable users to create, read, update, and delete personal fitness diary entries.
static_description: White background page with navy-styled list of past diary entries and a rich-text editor above it. Each entry shows title, preview snippet, timestamp, and edit/delete icons.

interaction_and_states.description: Submits new diary content via POST to diaryEntriesAPI and refreshes the list of entries.
Loads selected entry into the editor for modification, changes save button behavior to use PUT /api/diary/{id}.
Prompts confirmation dialog; confirms deletion via DELETE /api/diary/{id} and removes entry from list.

resource_dependency.leaderboardDataSchema: View combining user workout counts and points, e.g., SELECT u.username, COUNT(e.exercise_id) AS workouts FROM users u JOIN exercises e ON u.user_id = e.user_id GROUP BY u.user_id ORDER BY workouts DESC LIMIT 10
resource_dependency.refreshInterval: Poll every 60 seconds for updated rankings

function: Show ranked list of users based on recent fitness activity participation.
static_description: White background page with a navy-themed leaderboard table listing usernames and workout counts. Top three positions highlighted visually.

interaction_and_states.description: Every 60 seconds, calls GET /api/leaderboard to update rankings automatically without user action.
Immediately triggers GET /api/leaderboard call to update leaderboard manually.

resource_dependency.sessionStorage: Store JWT token securely after login

function: Manage secure access to individual user accounts and protect private fitness data.
static_description: White background landing page with centered navy-themed login/register tabs. Active tab displays corresponding form with labeled input fields and action buttons.

interaction_and_states.description: Calls POST /api/auth/login with credentials; stores returned JWT and redirects to dashboard on success.
Validates matching passwords and calls POST /api/auth/register; logs user in automatically on successful registration.

resource_dependency.dbConnectionConfig: Uses DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp
resource_dependency.databaseSchema: Tables: users, exercises, diary_entries, with proper foreign key relationships and indexes.

function: Serve structured fitness data endpoints consumed by frontend applications over RESTful interfaces.
static_description: No visual interface; this is a backend-only specification ensuring authenticated API routes return JSON responses for exercises, diary entries, and user stats.

resource_dependency.dynamicDataFetching: All pages fetch data via async HTTP requests to backend APIs
resource_dependency.loadingIndicators: Spinner components shown during API fetch operations
resource_dependency.errorHandling: Toast notifications display generic errors when API calls fail

function: Ensure all displayed content originates from live backend sources rather than hardcoded values.
static_description: Each frontend route renders skeleton loaders initially before populating content fetched asynchronously from backend services.

interaction_and_states.description: Initiates API calls to retrieve relevant data; shows loading spinner until response arrives.
Displays toast notification indicating failure to load data and offers retry option.

resource_dependency.connectionPoolConfig: Establish pool of reusable connections using provided environment variables

function: Connect application backend to external PostgreSQL instance using predefined configuration parameters.
static_description: Backend initializes database client using environment-based connection string at startup.

resource_dependency.componentStyleGuide: Apply navy color to all buttons, headers, cards, and interactive elements. Background set to white globally.

function: Enforce consistent styling across entire application using specified color palette.
static_description: Entire UI uses white backgrounds with navy text and component borders. All interactive elements styled in navy theme.

resource_dependency.exerciseListSchema: Same schema as global exercises table but filtered per user_id

function: Provide paginated browsing capability for viewing previously logged personal fitness sessions.
static_description: White background page with navy-styled filter controls and sortable table of user's historical exercises. Columns include date, type, duration, and actions.

interaction_and_states.description: Fetches additional batches of exercise records via GET /api/exercises with offset/limit query params.
Reorders table rows by selected column (date/type/duration) using updated query parameter in API call.

resource_dependency.visualizationComponents: Bar charts, pie charts, trend lines powered by Chart.js

function: Represent complex fitness analytics visually for easier interpretation and progress tracking.
static_description: Navy-themed card sections presenting various statistical visualizations such as monthly activity distribution, most frequent exercise types, and performance trends.

interaction_and_states.description: Adjusts chart data range by modifying timeframe query param sent to statisticalSummaryAPI.

resource_dependency.inputFormTemplates: Reusable React/Vue form components with built-in validation logic

function: Capture user-provided fitness activity and journal information via standardized web forms.
static_description: Consistent navy-themed form layouts used throughout app for entering exercise logs and diary posts. Include labels, placeholders, and submission buttons.

interaction_and_states.description: Triggers immediate field-level validation and displays feedback beneath respective input.
Clears all input fields and resets form state back to defaults.

resource_dependency.websocketIntegration: Optional WebSocket endpoint for instant leaderboard/statistic updates
resource_dependency.pollingMechanism: Fallback interval-based polling every 30 seconds for critical metrics

function: Maintain up-to-the-minute accuracy of shared fitness metrics like leaderboards and personal stats.
static_description: Leaderboard and stats pages silently update behind the scenes either via WebSocket events or periodic API polling.

interaction_and_states.description: Updates leaderboard rankings or statistic counters instantly without requiring manual refresh.

resource_dependency.profileDataSchema: Extended users table with goal_weight FLOAT, preferred_units ENUM(kg/lbs), notification_preferences JSONB

function: Allow customization of personal fitness preferences and goals within dedicated profile section.
static_description: White background settings panel with navy-styled editable fields for weight goals, unit preferences, and notification toggles.

interaction_and_states.description: Collects modified settings and submits them via PUT /api/user/profile then confirms update with success message.

resource_dependency.packageJsonStructure: { scripts: { "install:all": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm install\" \"cd backend && npm install\"", "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm run dev\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\"" } }
resource_dependency.folderStructure: Root directory contains frontend/, backend/, and shared/ folders with appropriate package.json files inside each.

function: Streamline development workflow by enabling unified installation and concurrent execution of frontend and backend processes.
static_description: Root-level package.json file defines convenience commands for multi-project setup and local development bootstrapping.
